item.title: Report X-2024091199
item.description:
Report X-2024091199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RECEIVED A CALL TO THE METRO BELT ALONG PD2 AT 11:45PM. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND A LEAKING HAZMAT WITH A FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 LABEL ON THE SIDE. COULD SEE THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING FROM THE INSIDE OUT. THEN FOLLOWED THE CLEAN UP PROCEDURE AND THEN BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP PROCESS AREA. THEN BEGUN TO PROCESS THE MATERIAL AS A LEAKER.

item.title: Report E-2024090358
item.description:
Report E-2024090358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The bottle of nitric acid was packed in accordance with lab pack standards and shipped to the 10-day transfer facility in Indianapolis. The package was transferred onto an on-site trailer at the facility and placed on top of a 5-gallon pail unsecured. When the trailer was subsequently moved into the dock, the lab pack box fell 18 inches and approximately 1/2 quart of nitric acid leaked from the package. The original container and the clean up residue were overpacked in a 15-gallon poly drum with vermiculite. The containers were not fully blocked and braced since the trailer was not leaving the site.

item.title: Report E-2024090339
item.description:
Report E-2024090339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When unloading totes of material it was noticed that their was a slight drip coming from the weld on one of the legs of the tote. It was a very slight leak and nothing spilled onto the truck. The tote was put onto a spill skid and the spot in the warehouse where the tote sat was cleaned up in house. We think from repeated transport of the tote that a weak spot was made in the weld of the body with the leg. Tote will be scrapped.
